definition: [Tic-tac-toe](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tic-tac-toe "Tic-tac-toe on Wikipedia") is a paper-and-pencil game for two players, X and O, who take turns marking the spaces in a 3×3 grid. The player who succeeds in placing three respective marks in a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row wins the game.

[Apophasis](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apophasis "Apophasis on Wikipedia") is a rhetorical device wherein the speaker or writer brings up a subject by either denying it, or denying that it should be brought up.

A [population bottleneck](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Population_bottleneck "Population Bottleneck on Wikipedia") is a sharp reduction in the size of a population due to extraordinary events which can reduce the variation in its gene pool.

[Contrapasso](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Contrapasso "Contrapasso on Wikipedia") refers to the punishment of souls in Dante's Inferno, by a process either resembling or contrasting with the sin itself.

The [Dilbert principle](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dilbert_principle "Dilbert principle on Wikipedia") refers states that companies tend to systematically promote their least-competent employees to management, in order to limit the amount of damage they are capable of doing.
“[Eureka](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eureka_%28word%29 "Eureka on Wikipedia")” is an interjection used to celebrate a discovery or invention.
[Fair use](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fair_use "Fair Use on Wikipedia") is a limitation and exception to the exclusive right granted by copyright law to the author of a creative work.

[Godwin’s Law](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Godwin%27s_law "Godwin’s Law on Wikipedia") is an Internet adage asserting that “As an online discussion grows longer, the probability of a comparison involving Nazis or Hitler approaches 1”.
[Hic Sunt Leones](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Here_be_dragons "Hic Sunt Leones on Wikipedia") was a phrase used by ancient Roman and Medieval cartographers when denoting unknown territories on maps.

The [Infinite Canvas](http://scottmccloud.com/4-inventions/canvas/ "Infinite Canvas by Scott McCloud") is a series of design strategies to lay out comics based on treating the screen as a window rather than a page.

A [Jesus Nut](http://it.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Jesus+nut "Jesus Nut on Urban Dictionary") is anything that holds together a critical assembly, such as a main roter on a helicopter. If the nut in question fails, then the equipment will catastrophically fail and everyone in/around it will be on their way to see Jesus.

[The Book of Kells](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Book_of_Kells "The Book of Kells on Wikipedia") is an illuminated manuscript Gospel book in Latin, containing the four Gospels of the New Testament together with various prefatory texts and tables.

[Lenna](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lenna "Lenna on Wikipedia") is the name given to a standard test image widely used in the field of image processing. It’s a picture cropped from the centerfold of the November 1972 issue of Playboy magazine.
The [Maya numeral system](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maya_numerals "Maya Numerals on Wikipedia") is a vigesimal (base-twenty) positional numeral system used by the Pre-Columbian Maya civilization.
The [Nadir](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nadir "Nadir on Wikipedia") at a given point is the local vertical direction pointing in the direction of the force of gravity at that location.
[Octopus wrestling](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octopus_wrestling "Octopus wrestling on Wikipedia") involves a diver grappling with a large octopus in shallow water and dragging it to the surface.

[Panspermia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Panspermia "Panspermia on Wikipedia") is the hypothesis that life is distributed throughout the Universe by meteoroids, asteroids, comets, planetoids and spacecrafts.

[Quan](http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=quan&defid=11277 "Quan on Urban Dictionary") is a loosely defined quality combining or uniting athletic skill with love and respect, as well as money.
The [Scoville scale](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scoville_scale "Scoville Scale on Wikipedia") is the measurement of the pungency (spicy heat) of chili peppers or other spicy foods.

[Towelie](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Towelie "Towelie on Wikipedia") is a talking towel who comes in and advises everyone to keep a towel handy whenever any subject involving water is mentioned, before asking if anyone wants to get “high”.

The [Utah teapot](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Utah_teapot "Utah Teapot on Wikipedia") or Newell teapot is a 3D computer model which has become a standard reference object in the computer graphics community. A teapot primitive is considered the equivalent of a *hello world* program

A [Watershed](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watershed_%28image_processing%29 "Watershed on Wikipedia") is a basin-like landform defined by highpoints and ridgelines that descend into lower elevations and stream valleys.

[Yukigassen](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yukigassen "Yukigassen on Wikipedia") is a snowball fighting-competition from Japan. Each game is played by two teams with rules similar to capture the flag: players are eliminated when hit with snowballs. A number of snowballs (90) are made in advance.

The *[Zeitgeist](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zeitgeist "Zeitgeist on Wikipedia")* is the intellectual fashion or dominant school of thought that typifies and influences the culture of a particular period in time.
